tasks.title: Create brainstorm command files
tasks.description: Create brainstorm.md, brainstorm.core.md, and brainstorm.details.md following MAHABHARATHA command patterns. Core file includes: flags, pre-flight, task tracking (TaskCreate/TaskUpdate), 4-phase workflow overview, completion criteria, help text. Details file includes: Socratic question templates (3 rounds x 3-4 questions), research analysis framework, issue template with gh CLI commands, output schemas (brainstorm.md, issues.json), example sessions. Main file mirrors core with SPLIT marker. Follow plan.core.md and plan.details.md as pattern references. Context management features: command splitting, scoped loading, session resumability, question batching.

verification.command: test -f mahabharatha/data/commands/brainstorm.md && test -f mahabharatha/data/commands/brainstorm.core.md && test -f mahabharatha/data/commands/brainstorm.details.md && grep -q 'SPLIT' mahabharatha/data/commands/brainstorm.core.md && grep -q 'TaskCreate' mahabharatha/data/commands/brainstorm.core.md && grep -q 'TaskUpdate' mahabharatha/data/commands/brainstorm.core.md

tasks.context:
## Pattern Reference
Follow plan.core.md structure exactly: SPLIT marker, title, flags, pre-flight bash, task tracking section, workflow phases, completion criteria, help.

## Flags
--rounds N (default 3, max 5) | --skip-research | --skip-issues | --dry-run | --resume | --help

## Context Management
1. Command splitting: .core.md (~30%) + .details.md (~70%)
2. Scoped web research: 3-5 WebSearch queries, cache in .gsd/specs/brainstorm-{id}/research.md
3. Incremental loading: PROJECT.md first, codebase only in Phase 2 if needed
4. Session resumability: save state after each phase
5. AskUserQuestion batching: 3-4 questions per round

## Task Ecosystem
TaskCreate '[Brainstorm] Discovery: {domain}' -> in_progress -> completed

tasks.title: Create feature issues for open-source roadmap
tasks.description: Create 6-10 GitHub issues using gh issue create. Each issue needs: clear title, problem statement (2-3 sentences), acceptance criteria (checkboxes), priority label (P0/P1/P2), competitive context from analysis. Issues: (P1) AI code review agent /z:review enhancement, (P1) Worker auto-recovery & health monitoring, (P1) Architecture compliance gates, (P1) /z:brainstorm command tracking issue, (P2) MCP integration for business context, (P2) Repository map with intelligent context selection, (P2) Benchmark suite for speedup claims, (P2) Interactive TUI dashboard /z:status --live. Optional P2: Multi-model backend support, Example plugins gallery.

verification.command: issue_count=$(gh issue list --state open --label brainstorm 2>/dev/null | wc -l); test "$issue_count" -ge 1 || gh issue list --state open | wc -l | xargs test 15 -le
